chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.

bsm_sss_stall : forall (P : nat * list (bsm_instr n)) (s : nat * vec (list bool) n), sss_step_stall (bsm_sss (n:=n)) P s -> out_code (fst s) P
sss_stall_step_0 : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (ii : instr) (P : nat * list instr) (q : nat) (st st' : nat * data), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> sss_stall one_step ii st -> sss_steps one_step P q st st' -> q = 0 /\ st = st'
subcode_cons_invert_left : forall (X : Type) (Q : code X) (i : nat) (I : X) (l : list X), (i, I :: l) <sc Q -> (i, I :: nil) <sc Q /\ (S i, l) <sc Q
subcode_app_invert_right : forall (X : Type) (j : nat) (Q1 Q2 : list X) (i : nat) (I : X), (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, Q1 ++ Q2) -> (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, Q1) \/ (i, I :: nil) <sc (length Q1 + j, Q2)
sss_loop_complete : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop), (forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : nat * data), one_step i s t1 -> one_step i s t2 -> t1 = t2) -> forall (P : nat * list instr) (pre : data -> Prop) (spec : data -> data -> Prop) (f : data -> data), (forall x : data, x <> f x) -> forall C1 C2 : data -> Prop, (forall x : data, pre x -> {C1 x} + {C2 x}) -> forall i p : nat, out_code p P ->...-> p = q /\ (exists n : nat, C2 (iter f x n) /\ spec (iter f x n) y)
sss_stall_step_stall : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (ii : instr) (P : nat * list instr) (st : nat * data), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> sss_stall one_step ii st -> sss_step_stall one_step P st
sss_step_subcode_inv : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (P : nat * list instr) (ii : instr) (st st' : nat * data), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> sss_step one_step P st st' -> one_step ii st st'
subcode_cons_invert_right : forall (X : Type) (j : nat) (J : X) (Q : list X) (i : nat) (I : X), (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, J :: Q) -> i = j /\ I = J \/ (i, I :: nil) <sc (S j, Q)
in_code_subcode : forall (X : Type) (i : nat) (P : code X), in_code i P -> exists a : X, (i, a :: nil) <sc P
sss_step_stall_inv : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (P : nat * list instr) (st : nat * data), sss_step_stall one_step P st -> {ii : instr | (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P /\ sss_stall one_step ii st} + {out_code (fst st) P}
subcode_cons : forall (X : Type) (P : code X) (n : nat) (x : X) (l : list X), P <sc (1 + n, l) -> P <sc (n, x :: l)
code = fun X : Type => (nat * list X)%type : Type -> Type Arguments code _%type_scope

```coq
intros Hsc Hx HPQ.
apply sss_step_subcode_inv in HPQ.
- destruct HPQ as [HPQ1 HPQ2].
  eapply sss_trans.
  + apply in_bsm_sss_pop_1.
    * apply Hx.
  + apply HPQ1.
- rewrite Hsc.
  apply or_introl.
  split.
  + reflexivity.
  + reflexivity.
Qed.
```

original: intros Hsc Hx HPQ. apply sss_step_subcode_inv in HPQ. - destruct HPQ as [HPQ1 HPQ2]. eapply sss_trans. + apply in_bsm_sss_pop_1. * apply Hx. + apply HPQ1. - rewrite Hsc. apply or_introl. split. + reflexivity. + reflexivity.
